sentence: Technology stocks were firming Tuesday, with shares of tech companies in the S&P 500 adding more than 0.9% in value while the Philadelphia semiconductor index was posting a more than 0.7% gain.

+ Salesforce.com ( CRM ) advanced on Tuesday, at one point rising almost 3%, after it said Torani, which produces and markets more than 200 naturally flavored syrups, sauces and beverage bases, is using the company's customer relationship management software to assist with its expansion plans and to improve customer experiences.
Torani is using salesforce.com's Pardot market automation as well as its Service Cloud application to create an unified desktop view of its customers.
Torani also is using the Marketing Cloud application to enhance its direct-to-consumer sales through its website.
Financial terms and other details of the new contract were not disclosed.

+ Simulations Plus ( SLP ) climbed to a record high on Tuesday, rising over 1% to a best-ever share price of $23.50 apiece, after the software firm said Shawn O'Connor was its new chief executive officer, succeeding Walt Woltosz, who was remaining board chairman following his retirement.
O'Connor recently was CEO at Entelos, which provides quantitative systems pharmacology software and services.

+ Aviat Networks ( AVNW ) increased over 1% on Tuesday after the mobile communications equipment company said it was eliminating 34 positions as part of a realignment plan to lower costs and improve profitability.
Aviat is projecting around $3 million in charges spread against its Q4 financial results and the first two quarters of its FY19.
It also sees the moves generating about $1.2 million in FY19 savings and rising to $3.2 million in FY20.

Separately, the company late Monday said it hired Stan Gallagher for the newly created role as chief operating officer, joining Aviat from Synergetics Installations Worldwide, where he was director of operational excellence and supply chain management during the past three years.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
